news.title: We will never work with Zanu PF, we want that party out of power – says Ibhetshu LikaZulu after allegations of collusion
news.content:
By Leopold Munhende

IBHETSHU LikaZulu secretary general Mbuso Fuzwayo has dismissed allegations that he is working with Zanu PF to ensure President Emmerson Mnangagwas term is extended beyond his constitutionally mandated two terms.Fuzwayo, who recently filed a Constitutional Court application challenging moves by the ruling party to extend Mnangagwas term to 2030, was said to have been working under direction from Zanu PF.The exit of one of the organisations top officials Gifford Sibanda, whose resignation letter expressed concerns with the manner their organisation had decided to fight Zanu PF, further raised eyebrows.That Citizens Coalition for Change (CCC) self styled secretary general Sengezo Tshabangus lawyer, Nqobile Sithole was representing him and Ibhetshu LikaZulu worsened the situation.Speaking to NewZimbabwe.com, Fuzwayo said there was no way they could work with Zanu PF and wanted the ruling party out of power.It is a narrative that is being peddled but the honest truth is that we will never work with Zanu PF, Fuzwayo told NewZimbabwe.comWe have no business with them, in fact we want them out of power.On Sibanda, comrades have a right to associate and deassociate.Fuzwayo is a hardened critic of the regime, whose organisation has stood toe-to-toe against Zanu PF repression and disregard for the Gukurahundi massacres.They have been the key figures highlighting how the state has continued to destroy plaques built in memory of the over 20,000 Gukurahundi victims.

IBHETSHU LikaZulu secretary general Mbuso Fuzwayo has dismissed allegations that he is working with Zanu PF to ensure President Emmerson Mnangagwas term is extended beyond his constitutionally mandated two terms.

Fuzwayo, who recently filed a Constitutional Court application challenging moves by the ruling party to extend Mnangagwas term to 2030, was said to have been working under direction from Zanu PF.The exit of one of the organisations top officials Gifford Sibanda, whose resignation letter expressed concerns with the manner their organisation had decided to fight Zanu PF, further raised eyebrows.That Citizens Coalition for Change (CCC) self styled secretary general Sengezo Tshabangus lawyer, Nqobile Sithole was representing him and Ibhetshu LikaZulu worsened the situation.Speaking to NewZimbabwe.com, Fuzwayo said there was no way they could work with Zanu PF and wanted the ruling party out of power.It is a narrative that is being peddled but the honest truth is that we will never work with Zanu PF, Fuzwayo told NewZimbabwe.comWe have no business with them, in fact we want them out of power.On Sibanda, comrades have a right to associate and deassociate.Fuzwayo is a hardened critic of the regime, whose organisation has stood toe-to-toe against Zanu PF repression and disregard for the Gukurahundi massacres.They have been the key figures highlighting how the state has continued to destroy plaques built in memory of the over 20,000 Gukurahundi victims.

Fuzwayo, who recently filed a Constitutional Court application challenging moves by the ruling party to extend Mnangagwas term to 2030, was said to have been working under direction from Zanu PF.

The exit of one of the organisations top officials Gifford Sibanda, whose resignation letter expressed concerns with the manner their organisation had decided to fight Zanu PF, further raised eyebrows.That Citizens Coalition for Change (CCC) self styled secretary general Sengezo Tshabangus lawyer, Nqobile Sithole was representing him and Ibhetshu LikaZulu worsened the situation.Speaking to NewZimbabwe.com, Fuzwayo said there was no way they could work with Zanu PF and wanted the ruling party out of power.It is a narrative that is being peddled but the honest truth is that we will never work with Zanu PF, Fuzwayo told NewZimbabwe.comWe have no business with them, in fact we want them out of power.On Sibanda, comrades have a right to associate and deassociate.Fuzwayo is a hardened critic of the regime, whose organisation has stood toe-to-toe against Zanu PF repression and disregard for the Gukurahundi massacres.They have been the key figures highlighting how the state has continued to destroy plaques built in memory of the over 20,000 Gukurahundi victims.

The exit of one of the organisations top officials Gifford Sibanda, whose resignation letter expressed concerns with the manner their organisation had decided to fight Zanu PF, further raised eyebrows.

That Citizens Coalition for Change (CCC) self styled secretary general Sengezo Tshabangus lawyer, Nqobile Sithole was representing him and Ibhetshu LikaZulu worsened the situation.Speaking to NewZimbabwe.com, Fuzwayo said there was no way they could work with Zanu PF and wanted the ruling party out of power.It is a narrative that is being peddled but the honest truth is that we will never work with Zanu PF, Fuzwayo told NewZimbabwe.comWe have no business with them, in fact we want them out of power.On Sibanda, comrades have a right to associate and deassociate.Fuzwayo is a hardened critic of the regime, whose organisation has stood toe-to-toe against Zanu PF repression and disregard for the Gukurahundi massacres.They have been the key figures highlighting how the state has continued to destroy plaques built in memory of the over 20,000 Gukurahundi victims.

That Citizens Coalition for Change (CCC) self styled secretary general Sengezo Tshabangus lawyer, Nqobile Sithole was representing him and Ibhetshu LikaZulu worsened the situation.

Speaking to NewZimbabwe.com, Fuzwayo said there was no way they could work with Zanu PF and wanted the ruling party out of power.It is a narrative that is being peddled but the honest truth is that we will never work with Zanu PF, Fuzwayo told NewZimbabwe.comWe have no business with them, in fact we want them out of power.On Sibanda, comrades have a right to associate and deassociate.Fuzwayo is a hardened critic of the regime, whose organisation has stood toe-to-toe against Zanu PF repression and disregard for the Gukurahundi massacres.They have been the key figures highlighting how the state has continued to destroy plaques built in memory of the over 20,000 Gukurahundi victims.

Speaking to NewZimbabwe.com, Fuzwayo said there was no way they could work with Zanu PF and wanted the ruling party out of power.

It is a narrative that is being peddled but the honest truth is that we will never work with Zanu PF, Fuzwayo told NewZimbabwe.comWe have no business with them, in fact we want them out of power.On Sibanda, comrades have a right to associate and deassociate.Fuzwayo is a hardened critic of the regime, whose organisation has stood toe-to-toe against Zanu PF repression and disregard for the Gukurahundi massacres.They have been the key figures highlighting how the state has continued to destroy plaques built in memory of the over 20,000 Gukurahundi victims.

It is a narrative that is being peddled but the honest truth is that we will never work with Zanu PF, Fuzwayo told NewZimbabwe.com

We have no business with them, in fact we want them out of power.On Sibanda, comrades have a right to associate and deassociate.Fuzwayo is a hardened critic of the regime, whose organisation has stood toe-to-toe against Zanu PF repression and disregard for the Gukurahundi massacres.They have been the key figures highlighting how the state has continued to destroy plaques built in memory of the over 20,000 Gukurahundi victims.

We have no business with them, in fact we want them out of power.

On Sibanda, comrades have a right to associate and deassociate.Fuzwayo is a hardened critic of the regime, whose organisation has stood toe-to-toe against Zanu PF repression and disregard for the Gukurahundi massacres.They have been the key figures highlighting how the state has continued to destroy plaques built in memory of the over 20,000 Gukurahundi victims.

On Sibanda, comrades have a right to associate and deassociate.

Fuzwayo is a hardened critic of the regime, whose organisation has stood toe-to-toe against Zanu PF repression and disregard for the Gukurahundi massacres.They have been the key figures highlighting how the state has continued to destroy plaques built in memory of the over 20,000 Gukurahundi victims.

Fuzwayo is a hardened critic of the regime, whose organisation has stood toe-to-toe against Zanu PF repression and disregard for the Gukurahundi massacres.

They have been the key figures highlighting how the state has continued to destroy plaques built in memory of the over 20,000 Gukurahundi victims.

news.title: Sikhala speaks on his South African arrest—says he was set up, as police review CCTV footage
news.content:
By Leopold Munhende

PROMINENT opposition figure Job Sikhala has described his arrest in South Africa for travelling with explosives as a set up by Zanu PF.

Sikhala was arrested early Friday morning when a car he was travelling in was stopped, searched and discovered to have 26 blasting cartridges and 15 capped fuse connectors; which are both forms of explosives.Images of him in handcuffs were plastered over the internet, with Zanu PF acolytes celebrating it like a win.He is being held at Pretoria Central and expected to appear in court on Monday.His South African lawyer Eric Mabuza said Sikhala was denying any knowledge of the crime while the South African Police Service (SAPS) had already made efforts to review footage at a mall the former legislator visited earlier.Sikhala was said to have been arrested after going for dinner with one of his uncles (also in police custody).It is an allegation he denies, Mabuza told state broadcaster SABC after meeting with Sikhala.He says that this is foul play because when he went out with his uncle for dinner he was not carrying any explosives but those were found as he was driving out.He said he did not come here for explosives but for medical attention.Indeed, Sikhala has been frequenting South Africa for medical help after spending over 500 days in pretrial detention before being released without charge.He was not just kept under the worst conditions but subjected to inhumane treatment over the entire period, which not only cost him his law firm but almost derailed his political career.Jacob Ngarivhume, another opposition figure in Zimbabwean politics described the explosives as having been planted in a post on X that confirmed that his family had been made aware.The pressure group he leads, the National Democratic Working Group said it suspected foul play.

news.title: EazzyPay unveils unified digital payment platform; move set to spur Zim’s financial inclusion
news.content:
By Alois Vinga

A FORWARD-THINKING fintech company, EazzyPay, based in Zimbabwe, has officially launched a comprehensive digital payment platform aimed at streamlining both individual and business financial transactions.

The platform, accessible via mobile app, WhatsApp bot, and web interface, offers a seamless experience for a range of services, from purchasing electricity tokens and airtime to booking event tickets, paying bills, and even accessing corporate solutions like bulk airtime purchases and virtual fiscalisation devices.

EazzyPays launch comes at a time when digital payment adoption in Zimbabwe is accelerating.

According to the Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe (RBZ), the total transaction value processed via digital payment systems reached ZWL 205.49 billion (approx. US$7.78 billion) in August, with 71.42 million transactions recorded. In contrast, cash-based transactions totalled only ZWG 12.66 billion.

Speaking at the official launch event in Harare, EazzyPays Chief Executive Officer, Tabeth Revesai Nyahasha, emphasised the platforms potential to revolutionise the way Zimbabweans engage with digital finance.

With our unified approach, we aim to eliminate the inefficiencies that have historically plagued digital payments  from multiple platforms and long wait times to limited access and a lack of transaction transparency, Nyahasha said.

Our mission is to empower communities by offering a faster, more secure, and more accessible payment solution.

The Zimbabwean fintech landscape is rapidly evolving. Data from the central bank reveals that electronic transactions processed through the National Payment Systems (NPS) grew by 23.09% in Q2 2025, reaching ZWL 655.6 billion (approximately US$24.33 billion). Despite this growth, EazzyPay identified a gap in the market for a unified platform to address the fragmented nature of digital payments, particularly for retail transactions, which accounted for US$5.93 billion in the second quarter alone.

Payments Made Easy  EazzyPays tagline  underscores its core promise: simplifying financial transactions for both individuals and businesses. The platform seeks to increase financial inclusion, particularly in underserved rural areas, by offering a solution that removes barriers such as long queues, restrictive operating hours, and complex user interfaces.

Alex Kuzakwawo, EazzyPays Operations Director, assured users of the platforms robust security features.

With WhatsApps end-to-end encryption, all transactions are safeguarded, ensuring that only the user has access to their financial information, he explained.

Furthermore, payments are validated by EcoCash, where the users PIN is required for authorization. EazzyPay itself is a facilitator, ensuring that security protocols are strictly adhered to.

As Zimbabwe continues to transition towards a predominantly digital economy, EazzyPays platform is poised to become a key player in driving both financial inclusion and economic participation across the country. The launch reflects the broader trend of fintech innovation across Africa, where digital solutions are helping bridge the gap between the unbanked and essential financial services.

By replacing fragmentation with integration, were not just simplifying payments  were enabling a more inclusive, connected economy, added Nyahasha.

The platform, accessible via mobile app, WhatsApp bot, and web interface, offers a seamless experience for a range of services, from purchasing electricity tokens and airtime to

news.title: Supreme Court orders registration of Crest Breeders’ land grab as company pushes for compensation
news.content:
By Mary Taruvinga

THE Supreme Court has ruled in favour of Crest Breeders International (Pvt) Ltd, ordering the registration of its compensation agreement with the Government of Zimbabwe over the compulsory acquisition of its 1,057-hectare property and criticising the lower court for revisiting a matter that had already been concluded.

In a ruling delivered on October 30, 2025, Justices George Chiweshe, Chinembiri Bhunu, and Joseph Musakwa allowed the appeal with costs on the legal practitioner and client scale, setting aside a 2022 Administrative Court decision that had dismissed the companys application.Chiweshe, writing for the court, said the matter was res judicata, having already been determined by the Supreme Court in an earlier judgment. He said the lower court erred in entertaining a matter with regards to which it had previously rendered a determination.Not only was the court a quo functus officio, it disregarded the doctrine of stare decisis by purporting to overturn the decision of this court concerning the same parties, the same facts and the same cause of action, said Chiweshe.The case involved Crest Breeders former property, the remaining extent of Saturday Retreat in Harare, which the government sought to compulsorily acquire in 2013 under the Land Acquisition Act. Following objections, the company and government reached an agreement in which Crest Breeders would retain 407 hectares and be compensated for the remainder. Occupants of the land were to pay four United States dollars per square metre for the portions they occupied.The agreement was initially approved by the Administrative Court and confirmed by the Supreme Court. However, a group of 11 settlers later challenged the registration, claiming the deal was fraudulent and unfair. In 2022, the Administrative Court sided with the settlers, a decision which has now been overturned.The Supreme Court said the settlers had no legitimate claim to the property or the agreement.If truth be told, the core respondents are illegal settlers, with no legitimate claim to the appellants property, he said.They were not privy to the agreement nor were they adversely affected by its terms.He said the respondents had no locus standi to challenge the deal since they were neither parties to the agreement nor recognised beneficiaries of the land reform programme.The core respondents embarked from the very beginning on a futile exercise to assert what they perceived to be their rights, he said.The court reaffirmed the States right to acquire private land in the public interest upon payment of compensation.The sovereign State of Zimbabwe has eminent domain over all private property within its territory and can acquire such property in the public interest against payment of compensation.The judges ordered that the memorandum of agreement between Crest Breeders and the Government of Zimbabwe be registered in terms of the Administrative Court (Land Acquisition) Rules of 1998.They also ordered the settlers to pay costs of the appeal on the legal practitioner and client scale.Despite glaring shortcomings, the core respondents persisted with their claims, thereby putting the appellant unnecessarily out of pocket. The appellants request for costs on the attorney and client scale was meritorious, the court ruled.Crest Breeders was represented by Advocate Lewis Uriri and T.S. Nyawo of Nyawo Ruzive Attorneys, while the Ministry of Lands was represented by L.T. Muradzikwa.The settlers were represented by J. Koto of Koto & Company.

In 2022, the Administrative Court sided with the settlers, a decision which has now been overturned.The Supreme Court said the settlers had no legitimate claim to the property or the agreement.If truth be told, the core respondents are illegal settlers, with no legitimate claim to the appellants property, he said.They were not privy to the agreement nor were they adversely affected by its terms.He said the respondents had no locus standi to challenge the deal since they were neither parties to the agreement nor recognised beneficiaries of the land reform programme.The core respondents embarked from the very beginning on a futile exercise to assert what they perceived to be their rights, he said.The court reaffirmed the States right to acquire private land in the public interest upon payment of compensation.The sovereign State of Zimbabwe has eminent domain over all private property within its territory and can acquire such property in the public interest against payment of compensation.The judges ordered that the memorandum of agreement between Crest Breeders and the Government of Zimbabwe be registered in terms of the Administrative Court (Land Acquisition) Rules of 1998.They also ordered the settlers to pay costs of the appeal on the legal practitioner and client scale.Despite glaring shortcomings, the core respondents persisted with their claims, thereby putting the appellant unnecessarily out of pocket. The appellants request for costs on the attorney and client scale was meritorious, the court ruled.Crest Breeders was represented by Advocate Lewis Uriri and T.S. Nyawo of Nyawo Ruzive Attorneys, while the Ministry of Lands was represented by L.T. Muradzikwa.The settlers were represented by J. Koto of Koto & Company.

The case involved Crest Breeders former property, the remaining extent of Saturday Retreat in Harare, which the government sought to compulsorily acquire in 2013 under the Land Acquisition Act. Following objections, the company and government reached an agreement in which Crest Breeders would retain 407 hectares and be compensated for the remainder. Occupants of the land were to pay four United States dollars per square metre for the portions they occupied.

The agreement was initially approved by the Administrative Court and confirmed by the Supreme Court. However, a group of 11 settlers later challenged the registration, claiming the deal was fraudulent and unfair. news.description:
By Mary Taruvinga THE Supreme Court has ruled in favour of Crest Breeders International (Pvt) Ltd, ordering the registration of its compensation agreement with the Government of Zimbabwe over the compulsory acquisition of its 1,057-hectare property and criticising the lower court for revisiting a matter that had already been concluded. In a ruling delivered on

The post Supreme Court orders registration of Crest Breeders’ land grab as company pushes for compensation   appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

news.title: Denver Mukamba set for Scottland FC return
news.content:
By Sports Reporter

DYNAMOS star Denver Mukamba is reportedly on the brink of rejoining Premier Soccer League (PSL) champions Scottland FC next season.

Mukamba was part of the Scottland FC side that helped the team get promotion from the lower division last year.After parting ways with Scottland FC, the 2021 Soccer Star of the Year went for six months without a club before tracing his footsteps back to Dynamos in July.At Dembare, he made an instant impact as the club has remained unbeaten since he started featuring for the Harare outfit.I am sorry to all Dynamos fans, but Denver Mukamba, I want him back at Scottland next season. He is a good player, and going into this level, we need him.I know Denvers abilities, and during pre-season, I even insisted that he be part of the team, but my coach did not buy the idea, said Scottland FC club president, Pedzisai Scott Sakupwanya.Mukamba is one of Sakupwanyas favourites. In September, he was blessed with a car gift and US$ 1,000 after his stellar performance against Scottland FC at Rufaro Stadium.

Mukamba was part of the Scottland FC side that helped the team get promotion from the lower division last year.

After parting ways with Scottland FC, the 2021 Soccer Star of the Year went for six months without a club before tracing his footsteps back to Dynamos in July.At Dembare, he made an instant impact as the club has remained unbeaten since he started featuring for the Harare outfit.I am sorry to all Dynamos fans, but Denver Mukamba, I want him back at Scottland next season. He is a good player, and going into this level, we need him.I know Denvers abilities, and during pre-season, I even insisted that he be part of the team, but my coach did not buy the idea, said Scottland FC club president, Pedzisai Scott Sakupwanya.Mukamba is one of Sakupwanyas favourites. In September, he was blessed with a car gift and US$ 1,000 after his stellar performance against Scottland FC at Rufaro Stadium.

In September, he was blessed with a car gift and US$ 1,000 after his stellar performance against Scottland FC at Rufaro Stadium.

In September, he was blessed with a car gift and US$ 1,000 after his stellar performance against Scottland FC at Rufaro Stadium.

I am sorry to all Dynamos fans, but Denver Mukamba, I want him back at Scottland next season. He is a good player, and going into this level, we need him.

I know Denvers abilities, and during pre-season, I even insisted that he be part of the team, but my coach did not buy the idea, said Scottland FC club president, Pedzisai Scott Sakupwanya.Mukamba is one of Sakupwanyas favourites. news.title: President Ramaphosa challenged to confront Mnangagwa over immigration headache as Zimbabweans continue trekking to South Africa
news.content:
By Darlington Gatsi

FORMER Mt Pleasant legislator Fadzayi Mahere has told South African President Cyril Ramaphosa to be bold and confront the Zanu PF government over the economic and political challenges that have forced Zimbabweans to migrate to his country.

South Africa has in recent years been buckling under a migration crisis, with Zimbabweans crossing the Limpopo River in search of greener economic pastures.

This has left Zimbabweans at loggerheads with South Africans, who accuse them of exploiting and straining social services.

Mahere said the root cause of migration is the economic and political challenges bedevilling Zimbabwe, which are forcing many to leave.

Your Excellency, we must also deal with the root causes of immigration to South Africa, especially from Zimbabwe. Why do you believe so many Zimbabweans are running away? It was not always the case. What changed?

Respectfully to what extent has South Africa, through successive administrations, taken an honest view about the Zimbabwean crisis?

Unless these questions are addressed, you will most likely continue to have hordes of Zimbabweans braving high fences, vicious crocodiles, the vagaries of the Limpopo and your law enforcement in order to escape the bigger crocodiles back home, said Mahere.

Numerous attempts by South Africa to curb illegal migration from Zimbabwe have been futile, prompting vigilante groups to attack foreign nationals.

Ramaphosa said his government is holding engagements with countries whose nationals are in South Africa illegally.

Engagements with countries whose nationals are frequent transgressors are ongoing through discussions with embassies, and these matters are also included as an Agenda item on Bi-National Commissions. This is to ensure that the implication of illegal migration is understood.

Illegal immigration does place a strain on our social services and undermines our national security.

We should not allow vigilante acts targeting foreign nationals as these do not solve the problem and they undermine the rule of law, said Ramaphosa.

news.title: PSL top goalscorer Navaya finally gets Warriors call-up as new coach names squad
news.content:
By Sports Reporter

TELONE striker Washington Navaya has received his first national team call-up after being drafted into the Warriors squad ahead of two friendly matches against Algeria and Qatar.

The Warriors will play Algeria on November 13 in Saudi Arabia before facing Qatar four days later.Navayas first inclusion into the national team comes after fans piled pressure for the leagues top goalscorer to get a chance in the Warriors colours.Aged 27, Navaya is currently the golden boot holder with 17 goals, two ahead of Scottland FCs Tymon Machope.Meanwhile, Scottland FC forward Khama Billiat is a notable absentee from the squad, and rumours have it that he is forcing his way back into international football after retirement.The upcoming two friendly games will see new Warriors coach Marion Marinica marking his debut since his appointment early this week as Michael Nees replacement.Warriors Squad:Goalkeepers:Washington Arubi (Marumo Gallants FC)Elvis Chipezeze (Magesi FC)Martin Mapisa (MWOS FC)Defenders:Gerald Takwara (Al Ittihad Misurata SC, Libya)Munashe Garananga (FC Copenhagen)Godknows Murwira (Scottland FC)Emmanuel Jalai (Dynamos FC)Teenage Hadebe (FC Cincinnati)Divine Lunga (Mamelodi Sundowns FC)Brandon Galloway (Plymouth Argyle FC)Midfielders:Jonah Fabisch (FC Erzgebirg Aue FC)Tawanda Chirewa (Wolverhampton Wanderers FC)Marvelous Nakamba (Luton Town FC)Sean Fusire (Sheffeld Wednesday FC)Prosper Padera (SJK Seina Joki)Jordan Zemura (Udinese)Daniel Msendami (Marumo Gallants FC)Strikers:Knowledge Musona (Scottland FC)Tymon Machope (Scottland FC)Prince Dube (Young Africans SC)Washington Navaya (TelOne FC)Tawanda Maswanhise (Motherwell FC)Bill Antonio (KV Mechelen FC)Walter Musona (Scottland FC)

news.description:
By Sports Reporter TELONE striker Washington Navaya has received his first national team call-up after being drafted into the Warriors squad ahead of two friendly matches against Algeria and Qatar. The Warriors will play Algeria on November 13 in Saudi Arabia before facing Qatar four days later. Navaya’s first inclusion into the national team comes

The post PSL top goalscorer Navaya finally gets Warriors call-up as new coach names squad appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.
